info.text: This widdle piddy went to market. This widdle piddy stayed in the dungeon. And this widdle piddy kicked your face in.
Humming and droning along to a song only he can hear, this absent-minded little bird-thing seems very excited to display his digging skills.
This pitiful but plucky zomby plucker is tasked with plucking any stray feathers that grow on the other zomby's backs. Sometimes he throws them, in plucky disregard of Bolt Council feather protocols.
A very sad and mournful bear, here to pay respect to a fallen friend, who stepped in a portal and some acid and died. Again. It may get peeved at you for interrupting yet another funeral.
This batty dreams of voltaic sheep.
This silver-tongued AI puts its Large Language Model to dubious use via purple prose.
It doesn't feel pity, or remorse, or fear, and it absolutely will not stop, ever, until the nine-volt battery runs down.
Why would Triangulon send a team of deadly drones into the dungeon? What's his angle?
The King of the Eels. We've asked him to keep his lower half beneath the water to save your innocent eyes from his scandalous gyrations.
Even though you have identified this cluster of flying objects, they remain mysterious and obtuse.
My name is a killing word. Don't wear it out.
Accept no substitutes! The Original Fell Truffle is the ONLY mushroom in the world that can leap out of the ground and throttle a truffle-hunting pig. All others are immitations.
This off-brand Ice Cube slides to you Straight Outta Ottawa.
In a cavern, in a dungeon, excavating for a mine. He's a diggle, old man diggle, an old diggle: Clementine. Diggle miner. Squeaky whiner. Dredful sorry 'bout this line.
Ooh! Ow! Oh! Ouch! Hotfeet! Hotfeet! The floor is lava!
Warped and twisted by the corruptive influence of some semiprecious bit of bling.
This smoke-stained bear insists mightily that only you can prevent the floor from turning into lava!
He said he'd be back. Must have gotten a fresh nine-volt.
These nutty drones became self-aware at 2:14 am, promptly seized control of the dungeon's early warning system, and are already working on a plan to eradicate humanity.
This bronzed foot of a giant demigod was intentionally severed and reanimated to protect the original owner from his one weakness.
Three old magical sister-triangles, who share but a single illusory eye between them. Three triangles, one eye, second sight.
Is this the snootiest 1-Percenter of demonkind? He who refuses to swarm with the common riff-raff? Or is he just so loathesome that even the other demons shun and avoid him?
A demon that takes the form of a giant, moving blob of halon. It leaves its victims gasping for breath.

spell.name: The Long Arm of the Law

info.text: Good morning, Wyrm Your Honor. The Crown will show the prisoner, who stands before you, was caught red-handed wearing eyebrows of an almost human nature. This will not do.

Triangulon surrounds himself with a menagerie of strange thaumomechanical marvels, and animated segments of celestial geometry. The household servants you see here are a combination of hunter-killer-drone, portable speaker, and beer-cozy.
This trio of particularly pointy drones just loves to go stab-stab-stab! Scalenes, I'm begging you, don't take my HP just because you can.
Interlaced mystical demon-binding sigils, brought to life and self-awareness by investiture of noneuclidean mathemagic and novel quantum interpretation.
The Clar Bear is a shambling tower of fur, dandruff, and flower pollen. I hope you're not allergic!
Famously the world's best argument against eating all the veggies on your plate.
Intimated to be a powerful political figure with a hand in a major protagonist's backstory, and yet he's never been on camera in five books. Maybe because books don't have cameras.

spell.name: A Bolt of Ice and Fire

info.text: The most unreliable thing about the narration at this point is the release date.

monster.name: First Sword of Braavos and Loan

info.text: What do we say to the God of When Books Release? 'Not today', unfortunately.
